bibl.title: Letter from Joseph H. White to Henry Rose Carter, January 14, 1924

div1.p: White expresses his relief that Carter's health has improved. He requests a photo and copies of some of Carter's publications for a Brazilian official.

div1.head: Letter from Joseph H. White to Henry Rose Carter, January 14, 1924
div1.opener:
RUA DA GAMELLEIRA, N.o 1
I.o ANDAR
TELEPHONE CENTRAL
CAIXA POSTAL, N.o 387
DEPARTAMENTO DE SAÚDE PUBLICA
COMMISSÃO DA FEBRE AMARELLA
BAHIA, BRASIL
Jany 14. 24
Dear Dr Carter:
div1.p:
I sent you a little note
just as I left N. Y. telling you how sorry I
was to learn of your illness and now I am
taking on the much pleasanter task of saying
how glad that I hear you are all right again.

Dont, dont undertake any more field
work. You have done your full share
for humanity and much more than your
share and while I know full well that
you will never rest, at least you can do
yeoman work at home without exposure
to hardship - with the pen.

Dr P. Garcia Medina Director de Sanidad
Bogota Colombia, in sending me a photo
of Genl Me'O Spain the President, writes that
he is very anxious for a photo of you
and one of those advance publications of
part of your work on Y. F. - I promised
him to try to secure both for him

Will you not oblige both Garcia M & me
by sending them to him? They will be
1
21
genuinely appreciated and the photo will go
into the salon of the National Laboratory
along with other men who have done things
for humanity in general and Latin America
in particular

I am writing Russell for maps and for
Y. F. histories and geographic and demographic
data as full as available to enable me to
make a careful study from all view points
of the African question

These is some commerce (in day trips)
between Dakar & this coast, which makes the
original opinion held by both of us (that
Africa should secure early and positive attention)
a really vital question right now

I recommended Connor, Pothier & Pareja
as commission to investigate rumors of Y. F.
in Cayenne, Dumarans Et al, and hope you can
concur in this

Hanson seems to be doing very well in Cal.
and if he dont “chase rabbits” too much (go after
small infected villages) he will make a fine job
of it.
With best wishes for your Carter “Salud”
